title: How did Jawaharlal Nehru's grandfather, Ghiyasuddin Ghazi, become Gangadhar Nehru? - Quora
tags: Politicians and Government Officials of India

response.answer_text: It is a concoction of some malcontents who are bent on proving Muslim blood in Jawaharlal’s lineage. I am no admirer of Nehru but he was a pure Kashmiri brahmin by origin as amply reinforced by authentic historical accounts.

No proof but just a rumour spread by those opposed to Nehru family. But Sir Tej Bahadur Sapru was certainly a 1st cousin of Mohammed Iqbal, considered father of Pakistan by none else but Pakistani`s themselves.Sir Tej Bahadur`s grand father was expelled by Kashmiri Pandits from their community, for falling into love with a Muslim girl and he converted to Islam, ultimately resulting in creation of Pakistan.
